title: U1C1.2_OneSidedLimits_AbsRatio
prompt: For $x\ne 1$, define $$f(x)=\frac{|x-1|}{x-1}.$$ Which statement is correct?

title: U1C1.2_LimitNotation_Interpretation
prompt: Suppose $\lim_{x\to 4} f(x)=7$. Which statement must be true?

title: U1C1.1_InstantRate_Sqrt_Rationalize
prompt: Compute the instantaneous rate of change of $g(x)=\sqrt{x}$ at $x=9$ using $$g'(9)=\lim_{h\to 0}\frac{\sqrt{9+h}-3}{h}.$$

title: U1C1.1_AverageSpeed_Interpretation
prompt: A car’s distance from home (in miles) after $t$ hours is $D(t)$. Which quantity best represents the average speed from $t=2$ to $t=5$?

title: U1C1.1_TangentSlope_DefinitionForm
prompt: Let $f(x)=3x^2-5x$. Which expression represents the slope of the tangent line to $y=f(x)$ at $x=2$ using the definition of derivative?

title: U1C1.1_DifferenceQuotient_CubicAt2
prompt: Let $p(x)=x^3$. Evaluate $$\lim_{h\to 0}\frac{p(2+h)-p(2)}{h}.$$

title: U1C1.2_LimitLaws_ShiftByConstant
prompt: If $\lim_{x\to 2}(f(x)-3)=5$, what is $\lim_{x\to 2}f(x)$?

title: U1C1.2_LimitExistence_PiecewiseAt0
prompt: Define $$f(x)=\begin{cases}2x+1,& x<0\\ x^2,& x\ge 0\end{cases}$$ What is $\lim_{x\to 0}f(x)$?

title: U1C1.1_AverageVelocity_SecantSlope
prompt: A particle’s position is given by $s(t)=t^2+2t$ (meters), where $t$ is in seconds. What is the average velocity on the interval $[1,3]$?

title: U1C1.2_Notation_LeftHandLimit
prompt: Which notation correctly describes the left-hand limit of $f(x)$ as $x$ approaches $5$?

title: 1.10-P5
prompt:
For what value of $k$ is the function
$$
f(x) = \left\{ \begin{array}{ll} \frac{x^2-1}{x-1}, & x \neq 1 \\ k, & x=1 \end{array} \right.
$$
continuous at $x=1$?

title: 1.11-P5
prompt:
For what value of $a$ is the function
$$
f(x) = \left\{ \begin{array}{ll} ax+3, & x < 2 \\ x^2+a, & x \ge 2 \end{array} \right.
$$
continuous at $x=2$?

title: 1.16-P4
prompt: Which situation does NOT allow you to conclude that there exists c in $(a,b)$ such that $f(c)=0$?

title: 1.13-P1
prompt:
For what value of $k$ is the function
$$
f(x) = \left\{ \begin{array}{ll} \frac{x^2-4}{x-2}, & x \neq 2 \\ k, & x=2 \end{array} \right.
$$
continuous at $x=2$?

title: 1.16-P5
prompt: Let $f(x)=x^3-6x+1$. Which statement is true?

title: 1.6-P5
prompt: Evaluate $\lim_{x\ \to 0} \frac{\sqrt{1+x}-1}{x}$.

title: 1.13-P5
prompt:
For what value of $a$ is the function
$$
f(x) = \left\{ \begin{array}{ll} a\sin x, & x < 0 \\ x^2+a, & x \ge 0 \end{array} \right.
$$
continuous at $x=0$?

title: 1.5-P2
prompt: Evaluate $\lim_{x\ \to 3} (2x^2-5x+1)$.

title: 1.8-P5
prompt: Evaluate $\lim_{x\ \to 0} \frac{x^2\cos\left(\frac{1}{x}\right)}{|x|}$.

title: 1.13-P3
prompt: Suppose $\lim_{x\ \to 3} f(x)=7$, but $f(3)$ is not defined. Which statement is true?

title: 1.6-P1
prompt: Evaluate $\lim_{x\ \to 3} \frac{x^2-9}{x-3}$.

title: 1.8-P2
prompt: Evaluate $\lim_{x\ \to 0}$ |$x|\cos\left(\frac{1}{x}\right)$.

title: 1.6-P4
prompt: Evaluate $\lim_{x\ \to 2} \frac{x^2-5x+6}{x-2}$.

title: 1.12-P5
prompt: A function f is continuous on $(0,5)$ but is not defined at $x=0$ and $x=5$. Which interval is guaranteed to have f continuous on it?

title: 1.11-P3
prompt: Is the function $h(x)=\frac{x^2-4}{x-2}$ continuous at $x=2$??

title: 1.5-P3
prompt: Given $\lim_{x\ \to 1} f(x)=2$ and $\lim_{x\ \to 1} g(x)=0$, which statement must be true?

title: 1.13-P4
prompt: For what value of $k$ is $f(x)=\frac{x^2-1}{x-1}$ for $x\ne$ 1 and $f(1)=k$ an extension of f that is continuous at $x=1$?

title: 1.16-P2
prompt: A function f satisfies $f(0)=2$ and $f(4)=-6$. Which additional condition is needed to guarantee there exists c in $(0,4)$ such that $f(c)=0$?

title: 1.14-P3
prompt: Which value of $x$ gives a vertical asymptote for $f(x)=\frac{x+1}{x^2-4}$?

title: 1.5-P4
prompt: If $\lim_{x\ \to a} f(x)=4$, what is $\lim_{x\ \to a} \left(3f(x)-7\right)$?

title: 1.10-P4
prompt: For the function $g(x)=\frac{|x|}{x}$, what is true about $\lim_{x\ \to 0} g(x)$?

title: 1.8-P3
prompt: Evaluate $\lim_{x\ \to \infty} \frac{\sin x}{x}$.

title: 1.6-P3
prompt: Evaluate $\lim_{x\ \to 1} \frac{x-1}{x^2-1}$.

title: 1.9-P4
prompt: A function f is continuous on the interval $[0,2]$. If $f(0)=-1$ and $f(2)=3$, which statement must be true?

title: 1.8-P1
prompt: Evaluate $\lim_{x\ \to 0} x^2\sin\left(\frac{1}{x}\right)$.

title: 1.9-P3
prompt: Let $f(x)=\frac{x^2-1}{x-1}$ for $x\ne$ 1. What is $\lim_{x\ \to 1} f(x)$?

title: 1.14-P2
prompt: Which statement best describes $\lim_{x\ \to 0} \frac{1}{x^2}$?

title: 1.7-P5
prompt: Which statement best describes $\lim_{x\ \to 0} \frac{1}{x^2}$?

title: 1.6-P2
prompt: Evaluate $\lim_{x\ \to 0} \frac{\sqrt{x+9}-3}{x}$.

title: 1.11-P4
prompt: A function f satisfies $\lim_{x\ \to 5} f(x)=12$ and $f(5)$ exists. Which condition is still needed to conclude f is continuous at $x=5$?

title: 1.5-P5
prompt: Evaluate $\lim_{x\ \to 2} \frac{(x^2-4)}{(x-2)}$.

title: 1.11-P1
prompt: Which set of conditions is sufficient to guarantee that f is continuous at $x=a$?

title: 1.5-P1
prompt: Given $\lim_{x\ \to 2} f(x)=3$ and $\lim_{x\ \to 2} g(x)=-1$, find $\lim_{x\ \to 2} \left(f(x)+g(x)\right)$.

title: 1.16-P1
prompt: A function f is continuous on $[1,5]$. If $f(1)=-3$ and $f(5)=2$, which statement must be true?

title: 1.15-P1
prompt: Evaluate $\lim_{x\ \to \infty} \frac{4x^2-3}{2x^2+7x}$.

title: 1.8-P4
prompt: Evaluate $\lim_{x\ \to 0} x\sin\left(\frac{1}{x^2}\right)$.

title: 1.12-P3
prompt: A function f is continuous on $[-1,3]$. If $f(-1)=4$ and $f(3)=-2$, which statement must be true?

title: 1.12-P2
prompt: Which statement is true about continuity on an interval?

title: 1.16-P3
prompt: Let f be continuous on $[-2,1]$ with $f(-2)=5$ and $f(1)=5$. Which statement must be true?
